name: Grand Mirage Resort

reviews.title: worth travelling therel
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely staff, beautiful hotel and great room. However, the first few nights got no sleep due to fellow holiday makers, korean and russians making loads of noise. Know they are on holiday but by the time 3pm comes you just want your sleep. Hotel did try and eventually suceeded obtaining peace. Several items went missing a blouse and a bracelet, which was given to me on holiday for my birthday . Gutted and did spoil it a bit but saying that the hotel is paradise and we did have a great time so just go with nothing fancy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband booked this holiday as a surpries and i was dreading it to far, but my god it was worth the distance we stayed there for 14 nights and loved every minute of it the food was good loads of choice the entertainment good fun, the hotel was spotless as were the pools etc i had read that the beach was dirty but it wasnt that bad yes there was a bit of saeweed but people were cleaning all the time, i would recommend this hotel in every way but you are best going allinclusive as we did and the people we meet all said how amaxing they thought this hotel was but some had wished they had gone allinclsive,
reviews.title: amazin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Mirage for 13 nights. I would rate the hotel a solid 4 star, maybe 4.5. Compaired to 5 star in Mexico or the Carribean. When we arrived, we booked a room with a king size bed, but they put us in a room with 2 single beds. We requested a change and were told it would 2 days. It was nothing to stress about, so we went with it. In 2 days, they did move us, but to a room they knew the air conditioning did not work and it stank of cigarette smoke, so we again complained and they moved us to the third room, which was fine. The only real complaint is that they nickel and dime you to death, for an all inclusive except dinner, you pay for everything. Internet use $4 for 1/2 hour, $4 a day for gym use, the list goes on. We guess that this part of the world has not caught up to the rest. The hotel itself is beautiful and the grounds are kept spotless. The beach is cleaned daily and there is a bit of seaweed along the beach, but it is an ocean, not a pool. The staff are exceptional and will help wherever they can and even go a little bit extra if they can. The meals were good, although we found the buffet at dinner and lunch very expensive, so we ordered off the menu most nights we ate at the hotel, we found the price of the a la carte menu very reasonable, especially for a hotel. There are numerous restaurants all along the street just outside the hotel for few dollars cheaper, ask for a discount before sitting down, we usually got 10 - 20% off. Unfortunately, the outdoor shows were cancelled due to weather, but they moved them inside where they could.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are doing any touring, deal with Sarisana with Panarama tour group. He is on the second floor lobby area most days between 11 and 12. He will set everything up for you from Scuba diving to white water rafting to daily tours. We spent a few minutes with him a couple times a week and never had to worry about anything.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Haven

reviews.text: Overall, it was a very good experience and we would stay there again.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.text: We stayed in an ocean view room for only five nights.Booked through bali travel net for around $40 AUS/ night each.Excellent value with buffet breakfast included.Beautiful ocean views, clean rooms and the staff are extremely friendly.The beach is clean has a great pool and pool bar.Some very nice restaurants just in front of the resort in Bambu Bali and Kekak.Also we had an awesome meal at TAO just a short taxi up the road overlooking the beach.For the price we paid you could not get better value even though we have stayed at better five star resorts.Would definately recommend to friends and also visit again.
reviews.title: Great valu for money
Great and Relaxing Vacation
reviews.text: We did select the Grand Mirage based on the many comments you can find in the web and at no stage have we found anything bad about the hotel . We did have a wonderful looking room facing the ocean , the rooms have been cleaned at all time , yes maybe the rooms are not new but you have everything you need and a big balcony . Emoloyyes are very very friendly and help or entertain you at any time. Activities are great , very big beach area , the ocean is as clean as it can get I could not agree with some of the comments about the Ocean and the seaweed , every day we spend at least 2 hours in the see. Breakfast has a wide selection . Overall I must say this hotel is the best Resort I have been within Asia over the past 4 years . Keep it up Grand Mirage

reviews.title: LOVE IT BUT!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I love my stay at Grand Mirage Hotel, however I'm truly disappointed with the security here. We stay at this hotel from 8th Oct - 12th Oct, I was staying in Room 2236 with a connecting door to room 2237 (We were on our company trip).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On 11th October (Saturday) I clearly leaving my digital camera on the dressing table and leave a message "privacy" at the door from 1pm to 6pm (as we are out for shopping and spa, therefore we do not need to bring our camera along). We leave the room again from 7:20pm to 12:30am and with the sign at the door "privacy" as we are going to check out the next day, we do not require house keeping to clean our room.
reviews.title: Loved Grand Mirage Nusa Dua

likes.disliked: — The prices of the taxi and tours - way overpriced

reviews.text: I only realize the camera missing as we pack for check out on 12th Oct (Sunday) morning. This person could have come in from room 2237 as we leave the connecting door open at all times. I'm sure like the hotel can check who have the access to the room during this time. I sincerely hope they are looking into this.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Time at the Grand Mirage
Not a family friendly hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Mirage in Tanjung Benoa - about 5 mins from Nusa Dua - for 6nts. We loved it. The area is nice because it has lots of lovely restaurants right opposite the hotel, there are massage parlors, a supermarket, lots of currency exchanges - which give a better rate than both the airport and the hotel and it has a shuttle to the Bali Collection. The Aston and the Conrad are on the same road. The breakfasts were very nice with a variety of food, and fruit. The staff were very friendly. The room and bathroom were very nice. Beach and poolside facilities very nice. Just don't take a taxi from the hotel or use their tours - they are very expensive. We wanted to go to Jimbaran, we were quoted 80 000 rupiah by the hotel for a one way, we walked outside the hotel and got a taxi for 50 000 rupiah. The same with a taxi to Kuta. The hotel said it was 150 000 return. We got it for 40 000 to Kuta.

We stayed at the Grand Mirage 17 - 25 September 2008. Check in was swift and cold towels were provided. The room was nice, the air-con efficient. The bathroom had shutters into the bedroom and they didn't fit too well. Plenty of space in the room. The bathroom was a little tired, but there were plenty of toiletries. The balcony was roomy and nice to sit on. I didn't get troubled by insects at all, but my friend did occasionally though we're not sure where or when. The beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed at the Grand Mirage (after a very enjoyable stay in 2007) and I must say that we were very disappointed with the service we received on this occasion and will not be going back a third time.
reviews.title: Disappointing service and attitude

likes.disliked: — Twin beds when double requested and no interested staff to rectify the situation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were travelling with two other couples and had requested 3 double ocean view rooms. When we arrived at the hotel about midnight we were informed that all 3 rooms had twin beds and we were very unhappy about this. However the reception staff said that they would rectify this in the morning for us, so as it was so late and we were staying for a week we decided to take them at their word.
reviews.title: great breakfast!

reviews.text: Well, next morning, we went to organise the new rooms, but of course there had been a change of shifts and no-one knew anything about it. After lots of running around trying to look busy finding something, we were told to come back at 2pm and see someone else who would definitely have rooms available for us. Needless to say that everyone just passed the buck continuously over the next few days, always saying that someone else would fix it.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — The time it took to get to Kuta, Seminyak etc.

reviews.text: Eventually after being given this runaround we insisted on seeing the manager who took quite a few hours to be available and then was told that no other rooms were available at all and never had been. We were told that the best they could do was push the beds together which in some of the rooms was impossible because of the room setup. In the end after a few days of this and becoming quite angry with the manager we were offered free meal vouchers to compensate, which really did nothing to make up for being told lie after lie about rectifying the situation. We tried to get a refund and go somewhere else, but of course we had paid in full and they had no intention of returning any of our money.
reviews.title: Friendly Family Hotel - All Inclusive Option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I felt that we were treated very badly in respect to this situation especially considering that we were repeat customers. I also find it very hard to believe that in a hotel of this size that not one of the 3 couples could have been relocated to a double room in a week long period. I think that it was just all too hard for anyone to have to deal with.
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I and my wife stayed at the Grand Mirage Resort this November. I must say it was a thoroughly satisfying experience right from the beginning. We were upgraded to the Romantic Ocean View room on arrival. We did have to wait for some time while the room was readied; in the meantime we were given our welcome drinks. The whole staff and I mean each and everyone we interacted with was very very friendly.
reviews.title: Great place for a vacation

reviews.text: The room was good - neat, clean and spacious. It had a balcony which faced the ocean on one side and the pool on another. The hotel itself is huge and beautifully landscaped. There is a waterfall, lots of greenery and lots of sculptures. It has its own private beach (although it is not too clean and hence going into the water wasn’t possible), water sports, pools, game rooms, spa, etc.
reviews.title: Hotel Fair, Food Not Good.

reviews.text: We can’t comment much on the food since we did not have any meals there except the breakfast, which was a buffet. It was good and had sufficient choice. The other meals too were buffets but the price was on the higher side. But this was more than compensated by the numerous decently priced restaurants bang opposite grand mirage.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC HOLIDAY!!

likes.liked: — The exceptional staff and great all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it was a pleasurable experience and I would recommend the place to anyone whether they are going for their honeymoon or with a group of friends or with their families.
reviews.title: Great Holiday Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have alrady posted this review once already. But for some reason better known to someone, it was taken off. So here it is again. Surely I have as much say as the next person.
reviews.title: Not my favorite hotel

likes.disliked: — Toooo busy and packed with novice travelers

description: Grand Mirage Resort & Thalasso Bali is a 5 Star Bali Resort with a large white sandy beach right in front of the resort. With 301 rooms & suites it is set among beautifully landscaped tropical gardens. Rising like a vision from the Balinese sea, it is located on the tip of Nusa Dua beach, in the village of Tanjung Benoa, Bali’s watersport center. Prime positioned only 20 minutes from Bali airport the Grand Mirage Resort is the perfect choice for a serene getaway to the Island of the Gods.Offering an almost unlimited choice of fun, entertainment and leisure activities, the Grand Mirage Resort Thalasso Bali is synonymous with value and luxurious comfort.Grand Mirage is offering a whole new class of luxury all inclusive and room and breakfast packages. On top of it, it presents 4 world class gourmet restaurants of which one is available 24 hours, with a wide selection of food & beverage choices.Hotel guests may also enjoy the Thalasso Bali Spa and Aquamedic pool with each spa room designed with its own theme in mind, hosted by professional Spa therapists, giving the perfect relaxation.
